definition: lit. the eye cannot recognize the letter T (idiom); totally illiterate
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: Because of poverty father had no schooling and almost didn't know a B from a battledore.
sentences.chinese: 由於貧窮，父親沒有受過教育，幾乎是目不識丁。

sentences.english: Because of poverty father had no schooling and almost didn't know a B from a battledore.
sentences.chinese: 由於貧窮，父親沒有受過教育，簡直是目不識丁。

sentences.english: The two women, neither of whom could read, studied the precious slip of paper.
sentences.chinese: 兩個目不識丁的女人都把眼睛盯着這張寶貝字帖。

sentences.english: “I was illiterate until I was eleven, ” she told me.
sentences.chinese: “我直到十一歲都目不識丁，”她告訴我。

sentences.english: There is not among them an esquire, saving the unlettered magistrate.
sentences.chinese: 他們當中除了那個目不識丁的執事，沒有一個鄉紳。
